meanings.definition: The state of being extended in length or duration.
meanings.sent1: The extendedness of the bridge allowed for safe passage over the river.
meanings.sent2: The extendedness of the movie made it difficult to sit through in one sitting.
meanings.sent3: The extendedness of the meeting caused everyone to doze off.
meanings.sent4: Her patience had the extendedness of a rubber band, always stretching to accommodate others.
meanings.sent5: The extendedness of the road seemed to go on forever, disappearing into the horizon.

meanings.definition: The quality of being stretched out or prolonged.
meanings.sent1: The extendedness of the fabric made it ideal for making curtains.
meanings.sent2: The extendedness of the vacation allowed for plenty of relaxation time.
meanings.sent3: The extendedness of the joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His speech had the extendedness of a marathon, going on and on without a clear end.
meanings.sent5: The extendedness of the dog's yawn was comically exaggerated, showing off its long tongue.

meanings.definition: The act of expanding or enlarging in scope or range.
meanings.sent1: The extendedness of the project surprised everyone with its complexity.
meanings.sent2: The extendedness of the forest provided a sense of adventure for hikers.
meanings.sent3: The extendedness of the cake made it impossible to finish in one sitting.
meanings.sent4: Her love had the extendedness of an ocean, vast and encompassing.
meanings.sent5: The extendedness of the city skyline was breathtaking, reaching far into the distance.
